org.xlattice.httpd.sitemaker

Class NodeInfo

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.xlattice.httpd.sitemaker.NodeInfo

  • public class NodeInfo
extends java.lang.Object
    Container allowing SiteMaker to collect information relating to the node.info file to be used by the utility.
    Author:
    Jim Dixon

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      NodeInfo()

      void setMaster(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of the master key; this is typically a fully qualified domain name, such as master.xlattice.org.
      void setNodeKey(java.lang.String name)
      Sets the name of the configuration file for the node; this may be a fully qualified domain name, such as www.xlattice.org.

    • Method Detail

      • getDir

        public java.lang.String getDir()
        Returns:
        directory the node.info file is located in

      • setDir

        public void setDir(java.lang.String dir)
        Parameters:
        dir - name of the directory node.info is expected to be found in

      • getMaster

        public java.lang.String getMaster()
        Returns:
        name of the Web site master key

      • setMaster

        public void setMaster(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the master key; this is typically a fully qualified domain name, such as master.xlattice.org. The master key may be used to sign configuration files for any number of sites and nodes.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the master key for the site

      • getNodeKey

        public java.lang.String getNodeKey()
        Returns:
        name of the node configuration file

      • setNodeKey

        public void setNodeKey(java.lang.String name)
        Sets the name of the configuration file for the node; this may be a fully qualified domain name, such as www.xlattice.org. This name can be used to retrieve a skeletal node configuration file from node.info (if one does not exist, it will be created.)
        Parameters:
        name - name of the master key for the site
